unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Mumbai Tackles Growing Waste Crisis with New Initiative**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Mumbai Tackles Growing Waste Crisis with New Initiative**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – In response to escalating concerns over waste management, the Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai (MCGM) has launched a comprehensive initiative targeting improved waste segregation and processing. The project, dubbed "Swachh Mumbai Abhiyan 2.0," aims to reduce the burden on overflowing landfills like Deonar.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – In response to escalating concerns over waste management, the Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai (M C G M) has launched a comprehensive initiative targeting improved waste segregation and processing. The project, dubbed "Swachh Mumbai Abhiyan two point zero," aims to reduce the burden on overflowing landfills like Deonar.

unnormalised: The initiative incorporates door-to-door collection drives emphasizing segregation of biodegradable and non-biodegradable waste, particularly in densely populated areas like Dharavi and Bandra. The MCGM plans to establish 10 new decentralized waste processing units within the next year, each capable of handling approximately 50 tonnes of waste daily.
normalised: The initiative incorporates door to door collection drives emphasizing segregation of biodegradable and non biodegradable waste, particularly in densely populated areas like Dharavi and Bandra. The M C G M plans to establish ten new decentralized waste processing units within the next year, each capable of handling approximately fifty tonnes of waste daily.

unnormalised: "Our goal is to achieve a 'Lagaan'-like victory against waste," stated Commissioner Iqbal Chahal, referencing the iconic Bollywood film about overcoming seemingly insurmountable odds. A pilot program is underway involving the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay to explore innovative waste-to-energy technologies. The project anticipates creating over 500 local jobs and promises to decrease the city’s reliance on unsustainable waste disposal practices by 30% within 3 years, saving the municipality an estimated Rs. 20 crores annually. Further plans include extending the program to cover surrounding areas within a 50 km radius of the city.
